intro: Eupatorium volkameriifolium, commonly known as the Volkameriifolium eupatorium, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has distinctive, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its showy, white to pale blue flowers bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators. It is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
